messages.subject: Re: copying from a book
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/12/02 3:50:04 PM Pacific Standard Time, ... My daughter takes ANY book and starts copying word for word (she is just starting to read and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/12/02 3:50:04 PM Pacific Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> She started copying word for
> word out of the book. When I couldn't contain myself any longer, I
> asked (with an effort to be casual), why are you doing that? With a
> laugh, she said, I don't know and kept doing it.
>
> I'm really curious why a person would want to do that. Any ideas? It's
> out of character and as far as I know she isn't even particularly
> interested in castles.
>


My daughter takes ANY book and starts copying word for word
(she is just starting to read and usually doesn't know the words
she is copying,,,but enjoys copying them anyway) She LOVES
writing and would rather use the book as a guide to the correct
spelling of words instead of asking me how to spell things for
her all the time.

Andrea Kim :-)
Mommy to two sweeties!
Laura (2/16/96) & Allison (8/31/99)
Kent, WA,,,,,,,,soon to be Seattle!









[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
